title: Drawing, "Architectural Fantasy with Vase, Herm, and Colonnade", mid-18th century
medium: Brush and gray wash, black chalk on paper with additions across upper and lower margin, lined with cardboard and border of blue paper
markings: Recto, lower right: Cooper Union Museum; verso: Cooper Union Museum stamp.
signed: Signed in pen and black ink at lower right: LL.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Ruins of a temple shown against a curved colonnade visible in the distance. A broken statue of a woman in the foreground leans against the base of a sepulchral monument surmounted by an urn.  Three male figures, one seated on a broken column, are visible among the ruins.

exhibitions.title: Excavating Design: 18th-century Drawings and Prints from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Architectural Fantasy with Vase, Herm, and Colonnade", mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Brush and gray wash, black chalk on paper with additions across upper and lower margin, lined with cardboard and border of blue paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-101.
